item.title: Loss functions: MAE, MAPE, MSE, RMSE and RMSLE
item.description: Loss Functions The loss function calculates the difference between the output of your model and the “Ground Truth” or actual values. There are multiple loss functions for regression and classification pourposes: All this functiones measure the ratio between actual/reference and predicted, the differences are in how the outliersd impact the final outcome. MAE MAPE Mean Squared Error (MSE) Incorporates both the variance and the bias of the predictor. RMSE RMSLE When the differences from predicted and actuals are large the log function helps normalizing this.
